{{Infobox military person |name= Peter Gillmore |image= |caption= |nickname= |birth_date= {{birth date|1905|10|17|df=yes}} |birth_place= |death_date= {{death date and age|1996|05|27|1905|10|17|df=yes}} |death_place= [[Henley-on-Thames]], England |placeofburial= |allegiance= United Kingdom |branch= [[Royal Air Force]] |serviceyears= 1923–59 |rank= [[Air Vice Marshal]] |unit= |commands= [[RAF Staff College, Bracknell]] (1951–53)
[[No. 64 Group RAF|No. 64 (Northern) Group]] (1948–51)
[[Wick Airport|RAF Wick]] (1943–44) |battles= [[Second World War]]
[[Malayan Emergency]] |awards= [[Companion of the Order of the Bath]]
[[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] |relations= |laterwork= }} [[Air Vice Marshal]] '''Alan David "Peter" Gillmore''', {{postnominals|country=GBR|size=100%|sep=,|CB|CBE}} (17 October 1905 – 27 May 1996) was a [[Royal Air Force]] officer who served as Commandant of the [[RAF Staff College, Bracknell]]. ==RAF career== Gillmore graduated from the [[Royal Air Force College Cranwell|RAF College Cranwell]] in 1925.{{cite web|url=http://www.rafweb.org/Biographies/Gillmore.htm|title=Air Vice Marshal A D Gillmore|publisher=Air of Authority – A History of RAF Organisation|accessdate=30 May 2015}} He became a flight commander first with [[No. 201 Squadron RAF|No. 201 Squadron]] in early 1935 and then with [[No. 202 Squadron RAF|No. 202 Squadron]] later in the year. He served in the [[Second World War]] on the staff in the Directorate of Plans at the [[Air Ministry]] before becoming Station Commander at [[Wick Airport|RAF Wick]] in 1943, Director of Operations (Maritime) in 1944 and Air Officer Commanding at Air Headquarters West Africa in 1945. After the war he became Director of Postings at the Air Ministry in 1946, Air Officer Commanding [[No. 64 Group RAF|No. 64 Group]] in 1948 and Commandant of the [[RAF Staff College, Bracknell]] in 1951.{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/obituary-air-vicemarshal-a-d-gillmore-1335683.html|title=Obituary: Air Vice-Marshal A. D. Gillmore|publisher=The Independent|date=6 June 1996|accessdate=30 May 2015}} His last postings were as Senior Air Staff Officer, [[Far East Air Force (Royal Air Force)|Far East Air Force]] in 1953 and then as Senior Air Staff Officer, [[RAF Home Command|Home Command]] in 1956 before retiring in 1959. ==Family== In 1931 Gillmore married Kathleen Morris; they had three sons. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{s-bef|before=[[Donald Hardman]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[RAF Staff College, Bracknell|Commandant of the RAF Staff College, Bracknell]]|years=1951–1953}} {{s-aft|after=[[Douglas Macfadyen]]}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gillmore, Peter}} [[Category:1905 births]] [[Category:1996 deaths]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:Companions of the Order of the Bath]] [[Category:Royal Air Force air marshals]] [[Category:Royal Air Force personnel of World War II]]
